title: How to Draw a Hexagonal Prism

steps.headline: Add vertical lines.
steps.description: For every visible corner, draw a straight vertical line.

steps.headline: Finish the base.
steps.description: Connect the end of the vertical lines to finish the prism base.

steps.headline: You now have your solid prism.
Color some details to make it look 3D.
steps.description: Add some shadings and lighting. Add a shadow opposite to your light source.

steps.headline: Draw a hexagon.
steps.description: This will be your hexagon's top base.

steps.headline: Add another hexagon.
steps.description: The second hexagon will be your prism's lower base. They should mirror one another.

steps.headline: Connect the lines.
steps.description: Connect each corner of the top hexagon to the bottom hexagon. Knowing this technique will help you make 3D prisms of any figure.

steps.headline: The final line art.
steps.description: For added effects, make the lines on the back a bit lighter. They should look like they're hidden from view.

steps.headline: Draw a polygon: this works with any shape you can think of like: a square, triangle, pentagon, octagon,hexagon or a decagon.
Draw an overlapping polygon, roughly the same size and shape.
steps.description: In fact, if you are in a computer drawing program just copy and paste your first shape right next to it.

steps.headline: Connect all the corners of the first shape to the congruent corner of the other shape.

For added effects, make the lines on the back a bit lighter. They should look like they're hidden from view. Color your prism.  Basic Hexagonal Prism Draw a polygon: this works with any shape you can think of like: a square, triangle, pentagon, octagon,hexagon or a decagon. A hexagon is used here. Draw an overlapping polygon, roughly the same size and shape. In fact, if you are in a computer drawing program just copy and paste your first shape right next to it. Connect all the corners of the first shape to the congruent corner of the other shape.
